snippet: Independent film used to define the cutting edge in entertainment, but the indie crowd has lately ceded ground to television, a trend at this year’s Sundance.
abstract: Shift in movie industry toward television is causing identity crisis of sorts at Sundance Film Festival, where most of movies that will be screened are likely to end up on video-demand system of some kind; festival has long been bastion for independent cinema and is trying to stay relevant as television's offerings become increasingly innovative.
lead_paragraph: Independent film used to define the cutting edge in entertainment, but the indie crowd has lately ceded ground to television, a trend at this year’s Sundance.

headline.seo: Television Becomes a Force at Sundance Film Festival
headline.main: Small Screen Is Big Player at Sundance
headline.print_headline: Small Screen Is Big Player at Sundance
